info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 26 at 6:18PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN ST. JOSEPH...BRANCH AND NORTHWESTERN HILLSDALE COUNTIES... At 617 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Union City, or 9 miles west of Coldwater, moving east at 55 mph. Storm spotters reported 70 mph winds and tree damage in Colon Michigan at 611 pm EDT. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained spotters. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Coldwater around 620 PM EDT. Quincy around 630 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Nottawa, Girard, Burr Oak, Allen, Sherwood, Fairfax, Leonidas, Batavia, South Butler, and Wasepi. This includes Interstate 69 in Michigan between mile markers 6 and 21. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. This is a dangerous storm! For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
